snippet: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million.
abstract: This low-budget film about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in about $22 million.
lead_paragraph: Score one for 20th Century Fox, whose low-budget movie "Chronicle" turned out a bigger-than-expected crowd at theaters on what is typically one of Hollywood's slowest weekends of the year. "Chronicle," about three teenage boys who learn they have superpowers, was No. 1 at North American theaters, taking in about $22 million, according to Hollywood.com, which compiles box office data.

headline.main: 'Chronicle' Leads the Way at Movie Theaters
